source:
#Question 0

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import requests
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

##for year Jun 1st 2018 to Oct 1st 2019

url="https://earthquake.usgs.gov/fdsnws/event/1/query?format=csv&starttime=2018-06-01&endtime=2019-10-01&minmagnitude=4"

response=requests.get(url)
data1=response.text

##for year Feb 1st 2017 to May 31st 2018 
url="https://earthquake.usgs.gov/fdsnws/event/1/query?format=csv&starttime=2017-02-01&endtime=2018-05-31&minmagnitude=4"

response=requests.get(url)
data2=response.text

##for year Jan 1st 2016 to Jan 31st 2017 
url="https://earthquake.usgs.gov/fdsnws/event/1/query?format=csv&starttime=2016-01-01&endtime=2017-01-31&minmagnitude=4"

response=requests.get(url)
data3=response.text


f=open('Earthquake.csv',"w")
f.write(data1)
f.write(data2)
f.write(data3)
f.close()
data=pd.read_csv("Earthquake.csv")

source:
#Question 6

data_sorted['mag']=pd.to_numeric(data_sorted['mag'])
new=data_sorted['time'].str.split("-",n=1,expand=True)
data_sorted['Year']=new[0]

x = np.arange(4)  # [0, 1, ..., 3]
group1 = data_sorted[data_sorted['mag'].between(4, 4.5)]
y1=group1.groupby('Year').size()

group2 = data_sorted[data_sorted['mag'].between(4.51, 5)]
y2=group2.groupby('Year').size()

group3 = data_sorted[data_sorted['mag'].between(5.1, 6)]
y3=group3.groupby('Year').size()

group4 = data_sorted[data_sorted['mag'].between(6.1, 7)]
y4=group4.groupby('Year').size()

group5 = data_sorted[data_sorted['mag']>7]
y5=group5.groupby('Year').size()

x_ticklabels = ['2016', '2017', '2018', '2019']
y_colors = ['#5B9BD5', '#ED7D31', '#70AD47', '#7f6d5f', '#2d7f5e']
y_labels = ['Group 1(4-4.5)', 'Group 2(4.5-5)', 'Group 3(5-6)', 'Group 4(6-7)', 'Group 5(7-8)']

# Setup 1 figure with 2 subplots
plt.figure(figsize=(6.4, 6.4))  # in inches, default is (6.4, 4.8)

# Grouped Bar Chart
plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
bar_width = 0.2  # 3*0.3 = 0.9
# Set the width in x for grouped bars
plt.bar(x, y1, bar_width, color=y_colors[0], label=y_labels[0])
plt.bar(x+bar_width, y2, bar_width, color=y_colors[1], label=y_labels[1], tick_label=x_ticklabels)
plt.bar(x+2*bar_width, y3, bar_width, color=y_colors[2], label=y_labels[2])
plt.bar(x+3*bar_width, y4, bar_width, color=y_colors[3], label=y_labels[3])
plt.bar(x+4*bar_width, y5, bar_width, color=y_colors[4], label=y_labels[4])
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Frequency of Earthquake based on Magnititude range')
plt.legend()

plt.tight_layout()  # To prevent overlapping of subplots
plt.show()

source:
#Question 8

data_sorted['mag']=pd.to_numeric(data_sorted['mag'])
data_sorted[['mag']].plot(kind='hist',bins=[0,0.5,1,1.5,2,2.5,3,3.5,4,4.5,5,5.5,6,6.5,7,7.5,8],rwidth=0.5,color='green')
plt.yscale('log')
plt.xlabel('Magnititude')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()

##OBSERVATION : Higher number of earthquakes around the world occurred within the magnititude range of 4 to 5.

#Question 9

data_sorted['depth']=pd.to_numeric(data_sorted['depth'])
data_sorted[['depth']].plot(kind='hist',bins=[100,200,300,400,500,600,700,800],rwidth=2,color='orange')
plt.yscale('log')
plt.xlabel('Depth of Earthquake')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()

##OBSERVATION: Higher number of earthquakes around the world occurred within the depth range of 100 to 200. Second most fron 500 to 600

#Question 10

data_sorted['latitude']=pd.to_numeric(data_sorted['latitude'])
data_sorted['longitude']=pd.to_numeric(data_sorted['longitude'])
x=data_sorted['latitude']
y=data_sorted['longitude']
plt.scatter(x,y, label='Earthquake', color='blue', s=5, marker="o")

plt.xlabel('Latitude')
plt.ylabel('Longitude')
plt.title('Earthquake Locations')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

newdata=us.states.STATES_AND_TERRITORIES

country=data_sorted["Place"].str.split(", ",n=1,expand=True)
new['col']=dfObj[0]
new['col']= new['col'].astype(str)

data_sorted['Country']=data_sorted['Country'].astype(str)
USADataset=pd.DataFrame()

for value in new['col'].items():  
 temp=(data_sorted.loc[data_sorted['Country']==value[1]])
 t=pd.DataFrame(temp)
 if(t.empty):
   print("Empty Dataframe for", value[1])
 else:
   USADataset=USADataset.append(t)
USADataset

#Question 12 b

USADataset_sort['mag']=pd.to_numeric(USADataset_sort['mag'])
new=USADataset_sort['time'].str.split("-",n=1,expand=True)
USADataset_sort['Year']=new[0]

# Setup x and y
x = np.arange(4)  # [0, 1, ..., 3]
group1 = USADataset_sort[USADataset_sort['mag'].between(4, 4.5)]
y1=group1.groupby('Year').size()

group2 = USADataset_sort[USADataset_sort['mag'].between(4.51, 5)]
y2=group2.groupby('Year').size()

group3 = USADataset_sort[USADataset_sort['mag'].between(5.1, 6)]
y3=group3.groupby('Year').size()

group4 = USADataset_sort[USADataset_sort['mag'].between(6.1, 7)]
y4=group4.groupby('Year').size()

group5 = USADataset_sort[USADataset_sort['mag']>7]
y5=group5.groupby('Year').size()

x_ticklabels = ['2016', '2017', '2018', '2019']
y_colors = ['#5B9BD5', '#ED7D31', '#70AD47', '#7f6d5f', '#2d7f5e']
y_labels = ['Group 1(4-4.5)', 'Group 2(4.5-5)', 'Group 3(5-6)', 'Group 4(6-7)', 'Group 5(7-8)']

# Setup 1 figure with 2 subplots
plt.figure(figsize=(6.4, 6.4))  # in inches, default is (6.4, 4.8)

# Grouped Bar Chart
plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
bar_width = 0.2  # 3*0.3 = 0.9
# Set the width in x for grouped bars
plt.bar(x, y1, bar_width, color=y_colors[0], label=y_labels[0])
plt.bar(x+bar_width, y2, bar_width, color=y_colors[1], label=y_labels[1], tick_label=x_ticklabels)
plt.bar(x+2*bar_width, y3, bar_width, color=y_colors[2], label=y_labels[2])
plt.bar(x+3*bar_width, y4, bar_width, color=y_colors[3], label=y_labels[3])
#plt.bar(x+4*bar_width, y5, bar_width, color=y_colors[4], label=y_labels[4])
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Frequency of Earthquake based on Magnititude range in USA')
plt.legend()

plt.tight_layout()  # To prevent overlapping of subplots
plt.show()

import plotly.graph_objects as go

USADataset['latitude']=pd.to_numeric(USADataset['latitude'])
USADataset['longitude']=pd.to_numeric(USADataset['longitude'])
x=USADataset['latitude']
y=USADataset['longitude']
plt.scatter(x,y, label='Earthquake', color='blue', s=5, marker="o")


plt.show()
